channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @frumfollies @JasonSCampbell Ultimately, Congress pays for the security guards.
@HeldShai @datadivajf When we stopped fighting about religion in the name of civility, religion lost all ability for self-critique.

@helenprejean @datadivajf As a nun, I ask you to deal with this advertisements from the manufacturer of the murder weapon. I’m not an expert in rye lines between blasphemy and sacrilege and heresy from a Catholic perspective, but it certainly seems what we Jews call treif. Time for some high level shaming https://t.co/HUj4OYn69P
@cstross Backpack nukes.

@Atrios Some clever suggestions for unilateral action in this thread; https://t.co/v25uOx6ayD
@Atrios But of course, such action risks offending the imaginary swing voters who the Hindenburg Democrats have granted the keys of the country to.

Your occasional reminder that Israel is not investing enough in time travel technology. If our past is important — and it is — it’s worth bending the laws of physics to see it in person. https://t.co/ARHVyS7zmo
And if a couple Hasmonean butterflies get trampled along the way — really, how much worse could it get?
This. https://t.co/0jyozSWJcS

@avitalrachel Did you see this teeet from earlier this month from the gun’s manufacturer? https://t.co/zNrEb7iLMS
@avitalrachel Also: AIPAC has endorsed that congressman and donated to him. So it might be a cult, and it might be blasphemy, but he can walk around with rabbinic endorsement.
@JasonSCampbell Schumer should push through a bill permitting open carry in the Supreme Court gallery.
@hilzoy See, the Catholics had centuries to figure it out. Evangelicals operate in an unregulated theological free-for-all.

@hilzoy Note that this is a biblical quote, and certainly heretical from a Catholic perspective, but they can put it out there with no fear of pushback.
@hilzoy But from a theological perspective, if he dies as a child he goes to heaven, but if he grows up and accesses forbidden literature, he might go to hell. So the incentives for Evangelicals really are different.
@owillis If his colleagues won’t call him out, and the Democrats won’t call out the Republicans for not calling him out, why should he act better?

@LeelaCorman @RokhlK See, working in publishing gives me perspective. I can’t wait for the profits that will be raked in by the authors of survivor memoirs in the wake of the Second Civil War. And the heartwarming historical novels!
@cstross The Ashton Tate program. I was trying to computerize records for a Jewish burial society on the Lower East Side.

@3illSweet @POTUS See, a leader like @dick_nixon would know what to do. Pay a few Cubans to kidnap a few Republican senators. Threaten to shoot them one by one until the the filibuster is overturned. Just don’t go on TV and whine.
@DervishWaking @effjayem @juliettekayyem No. Because we won’t say no to Republicans.
@cstross I was programming a database system in DBII (poorly) in the summer of 83, dreaming of the multitasking the forthcoming 386 hardware was promising….
@ebruenig Can we talk about heresy for a moment? https://t.co/ObCYJBxiaq
@inesanma @jackmjenkins Question for the Vatican: What is your response to this post from the manufacturer of the murder weapon? https://t.co/Z5EkxTk1hk

@ArthurLenk @springsteen I am indeed. Galei tzahal loved that song the years I was in Jerusalem.
@ArthurLenk @springsteen Say what you might about TMBG, but they never boasted of marrying ISIS.
@ArthurLenk I do hope the FM took advantage of his meeting to ask — not that it’s his business, of course — just why did Constantinople get the works?
@DiscordianKitty Because they believe God will punish those who tolerate deviance from authority but will reward innocent victims with eternal life.
